WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
I try to create a worksheet but I get the error message below.
I assume this has something to do with the french text "UBE5883105 PIGNON D'ENTREE" to do.
I run the program in a Mandriva 2007 Linux environment.
Before I start debuging this I just have to ask if you can give some advice.
Â

Comments.Message:
Hi,I try to create the worksheet from a mysqli result set. I loop thru the result row by row, column by column. This particular column is the only one I have had this problem with so far.I do not recognize any of the XML code in the error message, I assume it is generated by PHP Excel 2007 classes. The apostrophe (in the middle of the text) have a tendency to f-k things up.   Below is the piece of code that drives the error message.

while ($row = $result->fetch_row()) {	$rows++;	$cols = 0;	foreach($row as $value) {		$cell = $trow[$cols]['ExcelCol'] . $rows;		$objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()->SetCellValue("$cell", "$value");		$cols++;	}}

Hi,I had another look at my problem and I I think I know what's going wrong.I create an Excel file, adding a sheet at the time. For each sheet I load the existing Excel file,adding a new sheet and saving the file. At some time during this process the reader gets problemwith this column value, most probably in the last sheet created. So the XML file I load is infact an Excel XLSX file created by PHP Excel 2007 classes.
